In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Van G Logistics - Selma has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP/PSM/CalARP Program implementation.

Van G Logistics - Selma considers the RMP/PSM/CalARP Program a “living document”. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Van G Logistics - Selma employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP/PSM/CalARP Program Van G Logistics - Selma will continue to maintain overall plant worker, public, and environmental safety.

1.5.2 Emergency Response Notification Exercises

At least once per calendar year, Van G Logistics - Selma will conduct an exercise of the facility’s emergency response notifications mechanism. The facility will record each notification exercise utilizing PSMWriter.

Alternatively, the facility may meet the notification requirements through other exercises conducted to meet other Federal, state or local requirements, provided that the necessary notification is performed. Additionally, if a notification is made in response to an accidental release, this would also satisfy the notification requirement.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Van G Logistics - Selma has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker, public, and environmental safety. Nevertheless, Van G Logistics - Selma continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP/PSM/CalARP Program. This has improved Van G Logistics - Selma’s ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP/PSM/CalARP related events so that Van G Logistics - Selma’s management team can ensure that the RMP/PSM/CalARP Program is being implemented.

Van G Logistics - Selma has implemented all aspects of the RMP/PSM/CalARP Program. When a RMP/PSM/CalARP Program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with

stics - Selma has chosen to be a non-responding stationary source. Our employees will not respond to accidental releases of ammonia. In lieu of responding to accidental releases, Van G Logistics - Selma is implementing the following protocols:

The facility is included in the community emergency response plan developed under Title 42 USC §11003.
- Appropriate mechanisms are in place to notify emergency responders when there is a need for a response.
- Annual emergency response coordination activities are performed (Section 1.5.1).
- Annual notification exercises are performed (Section 1.5.2).

1.5.1 Emergency Response Coordination Activities

The purpose of emergency response coordination activities is to coordinate response needs with local emergency planning and response organizations. The intent is for local response organizations to be made aware of the regulated substance at Van G Logistics - Selma, their quantities, the risks presented by the covered process, and the resources and capabilities at our facility to respond to an accidental release of a regulated substance. The emergency response coordination activities will consist of the following:
1. Coordinations will be completed at least annually. Additional coordinations will be made to account for changes at our facility that may affect the community emergency response plan.
2. Coordinations will include Van G Logistics - Selma’s emergency response plan, updated emergency contact information, and any other information necessary for developing and implementing the local emergency response plan.
3. Coordination activities will be appropriately documented. The coordination records will include the names of individuals involved and their contact information (phone number, email address, and organizational affiliations), dates of coordination activities, and nature of coordination activities.
4. The disclosure of information classified or restricted by the Department of Defense or other Federal agencies or cont

e event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia
The ammonia refrigeration process at the Van G Logistics - Selma facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Van G Logistics - Selma has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Van G Logistics - Selma’s emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
Cal/OSHA’s Emergency Action Plan – Title 8 CCR §3220
U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration’s (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans – Title 29 CFR §1910.38
Cal/OSHA’s Process Safety Management [Emergency Response Program Requirements] – Title 8 CCR §5189(n)
U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration’s (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements] – Title 29 CFR §1910.119(n)
California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] – Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 §2765.1-2765.2
USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] – Title 40 CFR §68.90-96
California Hazardous Materials Business Plan (HMBP) [Emergency Response Plans and Procedures] – Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4 §2731

Process Chemistry
The refrigeration system employed at Van G Logistics - Selma is configured for pumped overfeed operation. 

1.2.4 Process Classification

The ammonia refrigeration system at Van G Logistics - Selma consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Van G Logistics - Selma is treated as a single process.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meetings we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.
Van G Logistics - Selma has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in th

rogram based on the PSM regulation to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP/PSM/CalARP Program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Van G Logistics - Selma operates a commercial cold storage/freezer for a variety of products in Selma, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:
(4) Cold Storage Rooms
(6) Freezer Rooms
(3) Loading Docks
(4) Blast Freezers
1.2.2 Facility Location

Van G Logistics - Selma is located at 14555 S Peach Ave, Selma, CA 93662. The latitude and longitude of the high pressure receiver is 36.524321, -119.720772. The facility is located approximately 3.5 miles east of state highway 41 and 5 miles west from state highway 43. The facility is located in a rural area surrounded primarily by agricultural land.
According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in “an area of minimal flood hazard”.

Van G Logistics - Selma is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Van G Logistics - Selma has a 1-2% chance of experiencing “potentially minor-damage” due to ground shaking in 2018.

1.2.3 Description of Covered Process

The refrigerated areas are equipped with air-cooling evaporators which are supplied from recirculators as required for pumped overfeed operation.

Most control valve groups are located on the roof to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within or directly abov

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program – Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) – Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program – Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program – Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP/PSM/CalARP Program.

This program is intended to be a “living document”. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Van G Logistics - Selma has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP/PSM/CalARP related activities. 

1.1 Van G Logistics - Selma, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Van G Logistics - Selma has updated their unified RMP/PSM/CalARP Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                      | Process Chemical                     | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration      Anhydrous Ammonia                29,000

Our RMP/PSM/CalARP Program promotes overall plant, worker, public, and environmental safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have:
